item.title: Clinton, MA
item.content:encoded:
Published in business-compliance

City compliance requirements​

City regulations can affect small business operations. The local regulatory requirements that may apply to small businesses are:

1. Zoning Permits

2. City Business License

3. Building Permits

4. Site Inspection

5. Local Taxes

For More details, check local municipality website

Small Business Federal Requirements​

Most common Federal Requirments are:

- Federal taxes

- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

- Marketing and advertising laws

- Copywright laws

- Workplace poster laws

- Workplace health and safety laws

- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to this section.

Local Regulations​

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements​

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in this section.

Checklist for Small Business Compliance​

- Zoning Regulations

- Business License

- Business Name Registration

- Legal Structure

- State Taxes

- Property Assessment

- State & Federal Labor Laws

- State Withholding

- State Unemployment Insurance

- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

Helpful Small Business Websites​

  1. - Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide
  2. - Application for Employer Identification Number (EIN)/Tax ID Number
  3. - Internal Revenue Service (IRS) Starting a Business and Keeping Records Form (PDF)
  4. - Patents and Trademarks
  5. - Free Market Research
  6. - US Senate Small Business Resources

Cities​

Clinton

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in this section.

Checklist for Small Business Compliance​

- Zoning Regulations

- Business License

- Business Name Registration

- Legal Structure

- State Taxes

- Property Assessment

- State & Federal Labor Laws

- State Withholding

- State Unemployment Insurance

- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

Helpful Small Business Websites​

  1. - Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide
  2. - Application for Employer Identification Number (EIN)/Tax ID Number
  3. - Internal Revenue Service (IRS) Starting a Business and Keeping Records Form (PDF)
  4. - Patents and Trademarks
  5. - Free Market Research
  6. - US Senate Small Business Resources

Cities​

Sheffield

item.title: Tyringham, MA
item.content:encoded:
Published in business-compliance

City compliance requirements​

City regulations can affect small business operations. The local regulatory requirements that may apply to small businesses are:

1. Zoning Permits

2. City Business License

3. Building Permits

4. Site Inspection

5. Local Taxes

For More details, check local municipality website

Small Business Federal Requirements​

Most common Federal Requirments are:

- Federal taxes

- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

- Marketing and advertising laws

- Copywright laws

- Workplace poster laws

- Workplace health and safety laws

- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to this section.

Local Regulations​

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements​

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in this section.

Checklist for Small Business Compliance​

- Zoning Regulations

- Business License

- Business Name Registration

- Legal Structure

- State Taxes

- Property Assessment

- State & Federal Labor Laws

- State Withholding

- State Unemployment Insurance

- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

Helpful Small Business Websites​

  1. - Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide
  2. - Application for Employer Identification Number (EIN)/Tax ID Number
  3. - Internal Revenue Service (IRS) Starting a Business and Keeping Records Form (PDF)
  4. - Patents and Trademarks
  5. - Free Market Research
